net.marfgamer.jraknet.server

Interface RakNetServerListener

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    ChatServer, RakNetServer, RakNetServerBundleExample

    public interface RakNetServerListener
    This interface is used by the server to let the user know when specific events are triggered

    Note: Do NOT use Thread.sleep(long) in any of these methods, as it will cause the server to timeout
    Author:
    MarfGamer

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      default void handlePacket(RakNetClientSession session, RakNetPacket packet, int channel)
      Called when a packet has been received from a client and is ready to be handled
      default void handlePing(ServerPing ping)
      Called when the server receives a ping from a client
      default void onAcknowledge(RakNetClientSession session, Record record, Reliability reliability, int channel, RakNetPacket packet)
      Called when a message sent with _REQUIRES_ACK_RECEIPT is received by a client
      default void onAddressBlocked(java.net.InetAddress address, long time)
      Called when an address is blocked by the server
      default void onAddressUnblocked(java.net.InetAddress address)
      Called when an address has been unblocked by the server
      default void onClientConnect(RakNetClientSession session)
      Called when a client has connected and logged in to the server
      default void onClientDisconnect(RakNetClientSession session, java.lang.String reason)
      Called when a client has disconnected from the server
      default void onClientPreConnect(java.net.InetSocketAddress address)
      Called when a client has connected to the server but has not logged yet in
      default void onClientPreDisconnect(java.net.InetSocketAddress address, java.lang.String reason)
      Called when a client that has connected to the server fails to log in
      default void onHandlerException(java.net.InetSocketAddress address, java.lang.Throwable throwable)
      Called when a handler exception has occurred, these normally do not matter as long as the server handles them on it's own
      default void onNotAcknowledge(RakNetClientSession session, Record record, Reliability reliability, int channel, RakNetPacket packet)
      Called when a message sent with _REQUIRES_ACK_RECEIPT is not received by a client
      default void onServerShutdown()
      Called when the server has been shutdown
      default void onServerStart()
      Called when the server has been successfully started
      default void onThreadException(java.lang.Throwable throwable)
      Called when an exception is caught in the external thread the server is running on, this method is only called when the server is started through startThreaded()

    • Method Detail

      • onServerStart

        default void onServerStart()
        Called when the server has been successfully started

      • handlePing

        default void handlePing(ServerPing ping)
        Called when the server receives a ping from a client
        Parameters:
        ping - The response that will be sent to the client

      • onClientPreConnect

        default void onClientPreConnect(java.net.InetSocketAddress address)
        Called when a client has connected to the server but has not logged yet in
        Parameters:
        address - The address of the client

      • onClientPreDisconnect

        default void onClientPreDisconnect(java.net.InetSocketAddress address,
                                   java.lang.String reason)
        Called when a client that has connected to the server fails to log in
        Parameters:
        address - The address of the client
        reason - The reason the client failed to login

      • onClientConnect

        default void onClientConnect(RakNetClientSession session)
        Called when a client has connected and logged in to the server
        Parameters:
        session - The session assigned to the client

      • onClientDisconnect

        default void onClientDisconnect(RakNetClientSession session,
                                java.lang.String reason)
        Called when a client has disconnected from the server
        Parameters:
        session - The client that disconnected
        reason - The reason the client disconnected

      • onAcknowledge

        default void onAcknowledge(RakNetClientSession session,
                           Record record,
                           Reliability reliability,
                           int channel,
                           RakNetPacket packet)
        Called when a message sent with _REQUIRES_ACK_RECEIPT is received by a client
        Parameters:
        session - The client that received the packet
        record - The record of the packet
        reliability - The reliability of the packet
        channel - The channel of the packet
        packet - The received packet

      • onNotAcknowledge

        default void onNotAcknowledge(RakNetClientSession session,
                              Record record,
                              Reliability reliability,
                              int channel,
                              RakNetPacket packet)
        Called when a message sent with _REQUIRES_ACK_RECEIPT is not received by a client
        Parameters:
        session - The client that lost the packet
        record - The record of the packet
        reliability - The reliability of the packet
        channel - The channel of the packet
        packet - The lost packet

      • handlePacket

        default void handlePacket(RakNetClientSession session,
                          RakNetPacket packet,
                          int channel)
        Called when a packet has been received from a client and is ready to be handled
        Parameters:
        session - The client that sent the packet
        packet - The packet received from the client
        channel - The channel the packet was sent on

      • onHandlerException

        default void onHandlerException(java.net.InetSocketAddress address,
                                java.lang.Throwable throwable)
        Called when a handler exception has occurred, these normally do not matter as long as the server handles them on it's own
        Parameters:
        address - The address that caused the exception
        throwable - The throwable exception that was caught

      • onAddressBlocked

        default void onAddressBlocked(java.net.InetAddress address,
                              long time)
        Called when an address is blocked by the server
        Parameters:
        address - The address that was blocked
        time - How long the address is blocked for (Note: -1 is permanent)

      • onAddressUnblocked

        default void onAddressUnblocked(java.net.InetAddress address)
        Called when an address has been unblocked by the server
        Parameters:
        address - The address that has been unblocked

      • onServerShutdown

        default void onServerShutdown()
        Called when the server has been shutdown

      • onThreadException

        default void onThreadException(java.lang.Throwable throwable)
        Called when an exception is caught in the external thread the server is running on, this method is only called when the server is started through startThreaded()
        Parameters:
        throwable - The throwable exception that was caught
